clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacodynamic Study of AZD1722 in End-stage Renal Disease Patients on Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Design Study to Evaluate the Pharmacodynamics, Safety, and Tolerability of AZD1722 in End-Stage Renal Disease Patients on Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the study drug is safe, tolerable and active in reducing fluid overload/weight gain between dialysis sessions for patients with End Stage Renal Disease on Hemodialysis.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a Phase 2, multi-center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacodynamics of the study drug in male and female patients with end-stage renal disease on hemodialysis. The study consists of a 2 week treatment-free run-in period where entry criteria are verified, a 4-week treatment period, of which the first week of treatment will be performed as an in-patient study in a clinical pharmacology unit (CPU) and the remaining three weeks of treatment will performed as an out-patient study, and a 2-week treatment-free follow-up period.
Safety assessments will be performed at regular intervals and will include clinical and vital signs, clinical laboratory evaluations, ECGs, and AE monitoring. Pharmacodynamic assessments will include, but are not limited to, interdialytic weight gain (IDWG), blood pressure, and stool sodium excretion. Pharmacokinetic assessments will include blood sampling for measurement of study drug plasma concentrations.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in mean weekly interdialytic weight gain (IDWG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Run-in period (Weeks -2 and -1) versus Week 4 (end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Run-in period (Weeks -2 and -1) versus weeks 1, 2, and 3 and follow-up, weeks 5 and 6

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of 4 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: AEs, SAEs, and safety laboratory evaluations.

intervention.description: doses between 5 and 90 mg may be administered based on tolerability
